page.title: 18SCHOOLS IN BENTHAM
page.content: There are three schools in the district. There is a Primary School in both High and Low Bentham and an independent Secondary School with a Prep Dept called Bentham Grammar School. The latter is located in Low Bentham. The Headmaster is R.S. Repper. He has a staff of 32 and 300 pupils. Of these about 50% are boarders. The school, founded in 1715, occupies the site of a former Rectory close by Low Bentham Church. Low Bentham and High Bentham County Primary Schools are controlled by North Yorkshire Education Committee. They take children from 5-10 years old before they move on to Ingleton Middle School and later Settle High School. The former's Head is Mrs A. Clements and has 47 pupils. The latter's Head is Mr D. Johnson and has 132 pupils.
